questions.questionText: 1) Which of the following methods is an entry point in the C# console program?
questions.explanation: The Main method is the entry point of a C# application.

questions.questionText: 2) Which of the following are values types in C#?
questions.explanation: A value type is either a struct type or an enumeration type. C# provides a set of predefined struct types called the simple types, and includes all aliased types.

questions.questionText: 3) Which of the following is a reference type in C#?
questions.explanation: Although string is a reference type, the equality operators == and != are defined to compare the values of string objects, not references.

options.text: It allows an instance of a class to be indexed like an array
It creates index for instances of a class

questions.explanation: C# indexers are usually known as smart arrays. A C# indexer is a class property that allows you to access a member variable of a class or struct using the features of an array.
The value of the String object is the content of the sequential collection of System.Char objects, and that value is immutable (that is, it is read-only).
